amendatorysection.para: (1) An applicant for licensure as an athletic trainer shall at the time of application provide proof to the department that he or she meets one or more of the following qualifications:
(a) Graduation after successful completion of the athletic training curriculum requirements of an accredited college or university approved by the board; or

(b) Graduation with a four-year degree from an accredited college or university and completion of at least two consecutive years, military duty excepted, as a student athletic trainer under the supervision of an athletic trainer approved by the board.
(2) In order to be licensed as an athletic trainer, an applicant shall, in addition to the requirements of subsection (1) of this section, successfully complete an examination approved by the board.

crossreference.para: Credentialing, general requirements and issuance procedures, see section 38-121 et seq.
